bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton, September 13, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 16. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, September 13, 1892
Mr. William D. McCoy, to the Department of State.
Submission of a note found on the Beach.
Inclosure-- 1. Note found on the Beach.
No. 16. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, September 13, 1892.
Honorable William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, WASHINGTON, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor of submitting to the Hydrographic Office, through you, the inclosed note which was found inclosed in a bottle which had drifted ashore about twenty five miles North West of Robertsport, Cape Mount, Liberia.
I would respectfully ask whether the finder, WIlliam Moore, is entitled to anything for his trouble and if so, how much shall it be?
